alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 11:19AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTHWESTERN MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 AM MDT... At 1119 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ledoux, or near Mora, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mora, La Cueva, Tierra Monte, Ledoux, Sapello, South Carmen, Manuelitas, Golondrinas and Rainsville. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 18. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 4. State Road 276 near Mile Marker 0. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 2. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 9 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Northeast Highlands
